objects.title: Department of General Fundamentals
objects.text: Core theory, Reinforcement, fields, elemental basics, the “101 courses” of the Clock Tower.

objects.title: Department of Individual Fundamentals
objects.text: Everything about the body, mind, and internal systems of a magus.

objects.title: Department of Spiritual Evocation
objects.text: Dead, spirits, exorcism, and anything that deals with “the other side.”

objects.title: Department of Mineralogy
objects.text: Stones, gems, metal, and hard materials as vessels of Mystery.

objects.title: Department of Zoology
objects.text: Beasts, mystic creatures, and the boundary between human and monster.

objects.title: Department of Astromancy
objects.text: Stars, Fate, celestial mathematics, and time-adjacent Mysteries.

objects.title: Department of Creation
objects.text: Mystic Codes, constructs, formulae, and the high art of building systems.

objects.title: Department of Curses
objects.text: Hexes, malign mysteries, and everything polite magi claim they don’t study.

objects.title: Department of Lore
objects.text: Forbidden theories, exoanthropic artifacts, and concept-level meddling.

objects.title: Department of Archeology
objects.text: Relic and ruin magecraft: excavating, decoding, and weaponizing buried mysteries.

objects.title: Department of Botany
objects.text: Plant-based magecraft: living catalysts, curse-eating gardens, and medicinal groves.

objects.title: Department of Modern Magecraft Theory
objects.text: New-age systems, techno-magecraft, and “unorthodox” approaches.

objects.title: Department of Policies
objects.text: Enforcement, secrecy, and policing the Moonlit World

rows.title: Introduction
rows.titleText:
You wake up in the dark. Just you, a heartbeat, and the weird little error message in your brain that says “I shouldn’t be here.” You try to remember what you were doing before this, but your thoughts slide off the past like water off glass. Someone is there. A woman, sitting just far enough away that you can’t quite see her face. You open your mouth to ask where you are, who she is, but she doesn’t answer. She doesn’t even flinch. After a long, brittle silence, she stands, turns her back to you, and walks out without a single word.

"Ah, sorry, sorry! Don’t mind her, she doesn't use a lot of words really.", A second figure appears as if they’ve always been there. “Hello, future Crypter! Congratulations on your successful… let’s call it relocation..."

"Who? Me? It's not important, I’m just the spokesperson for the Tree that picked you.", She continued. "What is important is that you’ve been selected for a very special project: pruning human history, nurturing a lovely little counterfeit world, and maybe, just maybe, replacing Proper Human History entirely. Exciting, right?”"

"Anyway let's cut to the chase! It might sting a teeny bit, but don’t worry, I’ll be watching very closely. Ready? Three, two, one—”, The last thing you see is their delighted smile, before an impossible light detonates behind your eyes and the Lostbelt’s past and future crashes into you all at once.

rows.title: Difficulty
rows.titleText: First, how hard do you want to bully yourself? Gentle story, desperate struggle, or “why did I do this” mode? Decide how much the world is allowed to step on you.

rows.title: Lostbelt
rows.titleText:
A tidal wave of data slams into your mind, names, maps, A plan to wipe out the human race, and somewhere in there is the little memo that says “congratulations, you’re a Crypter now.” Your new job? Babysit a pruned branch of history called a Lostbelt, a counterfeit world skewered on a giant Fantasy Tree and told to compete with Proper Human History. Fun, right?

Yours is Messier, the Tree of Death. It gets stronger every time something dies badly in your world and drips that back into you as Blessing. In exchange, you’re expected to nurture this off-brand timeline until it’s strong enough to overwrite the “real” one. Just don’t get greedy. Push your world too hard, twist it too fast, and its Stability snaps. A Lostbelt that collapses on its own doesn’t get to fight Chaldea; it just quietly falls off the board, and you go with it.

So, Crypter, first configuration step. What kind of wrong little world do you want to grow?

rows.title: Index

objects.title: Drop-In
objects.text: You will be dropped into the world in a new body with no history or memories of living in this world prior.

objects.title: Insert
objects.text: You wake up in a body that’s always “been” here at the age you choose, with memories and a backstory neatly stitched to match your future choices.

rows.title: Arrival
rows.titleText:
Regaining your consciousness, you notice a bright red symbol carved into your hand. It isn’t blood or paint- it's something else entirely. More worrying than that, though, is how your whole body feels… off- 

First things first: how are we dropping you into this mess? This is where you decide whether you show up as a complete stranger to the world, or slip into a life that was already halfway written for you. Pick your entry point ☆

objects.title: Kadoc Zemlupus
objects.text:
A silver-haired and slim young boy from Poland which joined Chaldea due to his capability to be a master. After he joined the A-Team, his pride feelings of inferiority became even stronger, as all his colleagues were first-class geniuses. 

Even so, he chose to whole-heartedly do his best to protect the Human Order, but his inferiority complex grew even larger after everything was rendered meaningless by Lev Lainur Flauros sabotage and being brought back by the Alien God. 

Special Attribute: Jack of All Trades

objects.title: Ophelia Phamrsolone
objects.text:
A girl who was born to the prominent Phamrsolone Magus Family in Germany, where her birth parents put her under immense pressure to become a first rate Magus through any means necessary. During the course of her childhood her parents subjected her through several, incredibly painful magical operations in order to increase her overall abilities that left deep emotional trauma to the young Ophelia and coupled with their magus mindset of obsessively pursuing the Truth, Ophelia did not receive much emotional support or love from them. 

Special Attribute: Mystic Eye of Prolongation

objects.title: Akuta Hinako
objects.text:
A girl shrouded in mystery and no one really knows about. She seems to dislike people and avoid talking to them. She is someone who would be happy just reading books all day long in the shade. From Chaldea Report, she was a magus that's enrolled in the Clock Tower Botany faculty and later became a technician for Chaldea. She was then personally chosen by Director Marisbury Animusphere as a member of the A-Team after her talent was discovered. Due to unknown reason, she often avoids medical examinations conducted by Romani Archaman.

Special Attribute: Yu Mei Ren

objects.title: Scandinavia Peperoncino
objects.text:
Real name Arou Myourenji, He was a Japanese magus who practiced Shugendō; more specifically, tengu arts. It was a school of Shugendō that took corrupting into a tengu and finding one's way to hell as a premise. 

Changing his name to Scandinavia Peperoncino and becoming a freelancer, he was recruited to Chaldea after Marisbury Animusphere met Scandinavia during his travels, Marisbury wanting to recruit a magus specialized in fighting. Scandinavia joined Chaldea Security Organization by Marisbury's recommendation and became one of the forty-eight Chaldea Master Candidates and a member of A-Team.

Special Attribute: Jinsokutsū, Tashintsū, Rōjintsū

objects.title: Kirschtaria Wodime
objects.text:
Kirschtaria Wodime was born into a thousand years old Magi lineage and is the head of the Wodime family. Kirstcharia was noted to have had a terrible relationship with his father due to his immense natural abilities and powers as a Magus far overshadowing his own. His father tried to have him assassinated sometime in his teens, that although unsuccessful, did end up permanently damaging his Magic Circuits. However, despite this normally crippling injury inflicted on him that would have destroyed most Magus's ability to perform Magecraft, Kirstcharia still retained his immense ability and latent talent in the art and was still deemed to be one of the best in the world and he was considered one of the most talented Magi of his generation.

Special Attribute: Anima Animusphere

objects.title: Beryl Gut
objects.text:
A mage from the Department of Botany at the Clock Tower. Although not renowned, he comes from an ancient family line. He was raised by his mother, a Witch, in the forest away from human civilization. During his childhood, he would request his mother to teach him Magecraft, specifically magecraft tailored for assassination, torture and murder. 

Eventually, when his mother ran out of things to teach him, he killed her and went to the city, where he became both a serial killer and an assassin. He is infamous for being a criminal, and a murderer who kills just for fun, to the point where he's considered by some to be a "disgrace to humanity."

Special Attribute: Red Hood

objects.title: Daybit Sem Void
objects.text:
Daybit was a magus who once enrolled in the Clock Tower's Department of Lore, and while it was publicly rumored that he was expelled from the Department, he actually left voluntarily to join the Chaldea Security Organization. 

Rather than being invited by Marisbury Animusphere, he arrived of his own initiative upon hearing of Marisbury’s research and interest in his background. Although having belonged to the Department of Lore for 8 years, His records before joining them is non-existent.

Special Attribute: Terminal of the Dark Star

objects.title: Mash Kyrielight (Clone)
objects.text:
A Clone created after Mash Kyrielight, an artificial human created by Chaldea and later, the Demi-Servant of Galahad. The project was started immediately following Chaldea's Success at creating a Demi-Servant of Galahad in the mold of Mash Kyrielight.

The clone purpose was to experiment on the possibility of creating an army of Demi-Servants. However, after Marysbury's death, this project was abandoned. And due to everyone connected to this highly secretive project being dead after Lev Lainur Flauros's sabotage, the clone of Mash was forgotten by all.

Special Attribute: Demi-Servant

objects.title: Cerejeira Elron
objects.text: Cerejeira Elron is a member of Chaldea Security Organization and worked as Chaldea Record Keeper. She likes to keep a journal as a hobby. She has an incredibly good memory, such as being able to recall every single moment her crush said her name

objects.title: Jingle Abel Meunière
objects.text: Meuniere is a member of Chaldea Security Organization and worked as the Coffins staff officer. She's one of Chaldea's Staff to help The Temporary Director, Romani Archiman and Ritsuka Fujimaru on The Goetia incident

objects.title: Yvette L Lehrman
objects.text:
Yvette is a student of the El-Melloi Classroom under Lord El-Melloi II and is a self-professed spy of the Neutral Faction of the Clock Tower. She is the daughter of the Lehrman family, a distiguished family who specializes in Mystic Eyes. When she first met Lord El-Melloi II, she immediately told him she was a spy for the Meluasteas. 

She's one of the many girls who wants to become Lord El-Melloi II's mistress, much to his annoyance. She is not above openly flirting with him in class or in public. However, her disappointment at her inability to get a rise out of Gray suggests Yvette may behave this way because she enjoys the reactions she elicits in others.

Special: Malachite, Ruby, Lolite

objects.title: Flat Escardos
objects.text:
Flat Escardos is a student of the El-Melloi Classroom under the Department of Modern Magecraft Theory in the Clock Tower. He was born into the Escardos family, a line of Magi living on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea, as the eldest son and an abnormality. 

When he was just a child, Flat was not only able to translate the ancient Magecraft of the Escardos Family, that even the Family Head was unable to understand, but he also was able to combine spells from the past into new forms of Magecraft which grave credence to his position as an ideal successor. However, this overwhelming power lead to Flat being regarded as an unnatural and dangerous person

Special: Prodigy

objects.title: Caules Forvedge Yggdmillenia
objects.text: Caules is a student of the El-Melloi Classroom under the Department of Modern Magecraft Theory in the Clock Tower. He  is the eldest son of the Forvedge family. Her sister, Fiore was born with exceptional Magic Circuits that appear in someone only once in a hundred years, but since it was uncertain whether the paralysis of her legs could be cured, the present head of the Forvedge family had his wife give birth to Caules as both a spare successor and a caretaker for Fiore. Unfortunately, a miracle didn’t occur a second time, and when he saw Caules’ mediocrity that embodied the decline of the Forvedge family, the family head decided that Fiore should be made the successor even if her legs didn't function and ordered Caules to be her caretaker.

objects.title: Fiore Forvedge Yggdmillenia
objects.text:
Fiore is a magus under the Spiritual Evocation Department in the Clock Tower. She was born into the Forvedge family and the older sister of Caules. However, Later on Fiore rejected the lifestyle of a mage and left home, and so Caules became the heir of the Forvedge family in her place.

She was born with exceptional Magic Circuits that appear in someone only once in a hundred years, but since it was uncertain whether the paralysis of her legs could be cured, the present head of the Forvedge family had his wife give birth to Caules as both a spare successor and a caretaker for Fiore.

She was originally paralyzed from the legs down and need to use a special mystic codes to move, but after having her Magic Circuits removed from her legs, her legs is no longer paralyzed.

Special: Bronze-Link Manipulator

objects.title: Luviagelita Edelfelt
objects.text:
Luvia is a student of the El-Melloi Classroom under the Department of Modern Magecraft Theory in the Clock Tower. Daughter of a distinguished lineage of magi, the Edelfelt, Luviagelita is their young and talented family head.

She became acquainted with Rin Tohsaka after she began to study in the Clock Tower after the Fifth Holy Grail War. She finds in Rin a worthy rival due to their similarities; their encounters always result in fierce clashes.

As long as Rin Tohsaka is not nearby, Luvia's attitude is always graceful, never blaspheming and displaying a beauty similar to that of a swan. Of course, that is all just a facade; as she is actually very competitive and suffers from perfectionist tendencies.

Although wealthy, Luvia does not tolerate excessive spending. However, she knows that such spending of money is meaningful because aristocrats are aristocrats.

objects.title: Rin Tohsaka
objects.text:
Rin is a student of the El-Melloi Classroom under the Department of Modern Magecraft Theory in the Clock Tower. She's formerly a participant of The Fifth Fuyuki Holy Grail War as the master of Archer. She's the member of the Tohsaka family, one of the 3 great magus family in Japan.

Rin was brought up as the successor to her family's magecraft, and was instructed by her father to prioritize magecraft over her own interests. Ten years ago, Tokiomi Tohsaka was selected as a Master in the 4th Holy Grail War, and Rin was entrusted to take care of the Tohsaka estate until his return. Her mother, Aoi Tohsaka, was left in a debilitated state from the war, so her care was left to her guardian, Kirei Kotomine. After her father was killed, Rin continued to improve her sorcery with some guidance from Kirei Kotomine.

Although Rin resents the sacrifices she has endured for the sake of tradition, she is fiercely competitive and eager to prove herself as a skilled and capable magus. 

Special: Average One

objects.title: Waver Velvet
objects.text:
Waver Velvet is formerly a student in the Clock Tower under the tutelage of Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald before the Fourth Fuyuki Holy Grail War, he later attains the position of Lord after being taken in by the El-Melloi faction, referred to as Lord El-Melloi II. He is the Lord of the Department of Modern Magecraft Theory and owns the El-Melloi Classroom. 

Waver takes on the title of Lord El-Melloi II, after the proper heir, Reines El-Melloi Archisorte, a young girl at the bottom of the family's hierarchy, recognizes his achievements, but only does so while letting him know that Kayneth's death was his fault and that he will have to serve her for his entire life. He was the youngest Lord the Clock Tower had ever seen. Amongst the twelve nobles who administer the Clock Tower, he's the lowest-ranked. He attained the fourth-order rank, "Fes", due to how good of a teacher he was, though if judged solely on his own abilities he would be the lower rank of "Count".

Special Attributes: The Twelfth Lord

objects.title: Reines El Melloi Archisorte
objects.text:
Reines El-Melloi Archisorte is the current head of the El-Melloi faction after the death of Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald. She is known as the Princess of El-Melloi. Reines was born in the Archisorte family, a branch family of the Archibald family. 

With the death of Kayneth in the Fourth Holy Grail War, there was a conflict on the succession of the El-Melloi faction as it fell into a state of great internal discord. Thus assets that were all amassed under the name of El-Melloi, were all stolen away by rivals and branch families of the Archibald lineage. As a result, the only things left over for the main family were the title of El-Melloi, and a debt of astronomical proportions. 

During this time, Reines was selected as the head of the El-Melloi faction. Reines's early life was mostly chaotic as she lived through a period filled with deception and assassination, where she learned to be constantly cautious of spies or enemies that threaten her life.

Special Attribute: Volumen Hydragyrum

objects.title: Gray
objects.text:
Gray is the apprentice and assistant of Lord El-Melloi II at the Mage's Association's Clock Tower. 

She  comes from the Blackmore Cemetery in Wales. The clan of the village there aimed to create a being capable of handling the Holy Lance that had been passed down for generations. In other words, their purpose was to revive King Arthur, in flesh and spirit. However, their attempts had thus far been continuous failures, and the ritual had been relegated to folktales and tradition.

Gray left the village when the corpse of someone who looked exactly like her was mysteriously found. At the time, Lord El-Melloi II was visiting the village hoping to borrow one of the gravekeepers of Blackmore as a trump card against Heroic Spirits in the Fifth Holy Grail War. Her caretaker, Bersac pushed Gray off onto Waver, entrusting her to be made his apprentice and admitting her to the Clock Tower of London,

Special Attribute: Vessel of King Arthur

objects.title: Bazett Fraga McRemitz
objects.text:
Bazett is a member of the Sealing Designation of the Mage Association. She was born in a coastal village in Ireland as a descendant and the current successor of an old family of magi that had detached itself from the Mage's Association and lived in the shadows quietly. In her childhood, she was not interested in anything, not understanding what others considered "fun."

Wishing to pursue a different path than that of her ancestors, she chose to join the Association when she was 15, to much fanfare for her bloodline and her lost arts. However, due to the internal politics of the Clock Tower, there was no room for a new house, so Bazett was unwanted within the Association. Despite this, she fought to be accepted; however, the more results she produced, the more a nuisance she was considered. Eventually, the Association sent her to become a Sealing Designation Enforcer. 

Two years after joining the Association, during one of her missions, Bazett met Kirei Kotomine, a member of the Church. Back when he was active as an executor working for the Church, they often ran into each other on assignments and fought together as comrades.

Special Attribute: Fragarach

objects.title: Other
objects.text: Build your own character and that person will already exist in Chaldea before the event of Grand Order and be one of the people revived by the Alien God.

rows.title: Character Insert
rows.titleText: You can always build a brand-new body from scratch… but isn’t it tempting to hijack someone already in the perfect position? Here you slip into the life of an existing Crypter candidate, Chaldea-adjacent soul, or maybe just someone from The Clock Tower who just so happens to be in the right place at the right time.

rows.title: Gender
rows.titleText: What do people see when they look at you at a glance? Pick the general shape of your presentation; the inside can stay as complicated as you like.

rows.title: Age
rows.titleText: How many years has this body supposedly been alive? Teen prodigy, young adult disaster, seasoned veteran, or “I’ve seen too much” old-timer. Choose the number of candles on your cake.

rows.title: Height
rows.titleText: Decide how far your eyes are from the floor. Short and underestimated, average and forgettable, or tall enough that people’s necks hurt when they argue with you.

rows.title: Hair Length
rows.titleText: From Avatar Aang to Rapunzel, how much hair are you lugging around? Easier maintenance vs dramatic swish? Either way, it’s another way to leave an impression (or a mess).

rows.title: Hair Color
rows.titleText: Black, blonde, neon nightmare... this is your palette. Pick the shade everyone will remember when they curse your name.

rows.title: Eye Color
rows.titleText: Windows to the soul, status indicator, or just another cosmetic slider. Choose the color that stares back from mirrors and wanted posters alike.

rows.title: Skin Color
rows.titleText: Tone in which your body gets rendered. Pick what the world sees before it notices the terrifying part.

rows.title: Body Type
rows.titleText: Soft, sharp, average, or built like a final boss? Choose the frame you’re going to be throwing into danger.

objects.title: Full Human
objects.text: Just a perfectly ordinary human, boring, fragile, and strangely reliable. No monstrous drawbacks, no special curses; you get standard magic circuits, decent compatibility with magecraft, and the comforting guarantee that if you die, it’s probably for very normal reasons.

objects.title: Homunculus
objects.text: You’re an artificial human brewed up through alchemy. Your body never ages in traditional sense. Your magic circuit is also much stronger allowing magecraft to be more potent, but your lifespan is shorter and your physique weaker than a standard human’s. You’re high-performance hardware with a looming expiration date.

objects.title: Android
objects.text: Your body isn’t fully human anymore; most of it has been swapped out with artificial parts that don’t care about silly things like “bleeding out.” You’re tougher, more precise, and you can shrug off a lot of damage that would cripple a normal mage. But machines and mystery don’t mix well, your compatibility with magecraft drops, and some rituals just refuse to acknowledge you as “properly alive.”

objects.title: Vampire
objects.text: You're Dead Apostles, once human, now a hungry little apex predator in a nice shell. Your body boasts high regeneration, overwhelming physical ability, and the kind of longevity that makes calendars meaningless. In return, you’re chained to blood, suffer under sunlight, and find the line between “strategic brutality” and “monster” getting thinner every night.

objects.title: Fairy-Blooded
objects.text:
Somewhere up your family tree, a fairy made a very bad decision, and you’re the result. Your body leans toward the unreal, more mystery than flesh, with a need for a clear “role” or “purpose” to stay stable; lose that, and you risk quietly unraveling. 

You grow stronger just by being around ordinary humans, just being near them greatly increases morale and spiritual fulfillment, but you struggle to genuinely empathize with them.

objects.title: Oni-Blooded
objects.text:
Oni blood runs in you, diluted but far from harmless. Your body is tougher, stronger, and more tolerant of wounds than a normal human’s, with a natural affinity for brutal close combat and one or two especially destructive talents.

You got stronger physique, regeneration and affinity to one of natural elements but with the cost of a craving for human flesh and a more volatile mind that could cause you to go berserk.

objects.title: Giant-Blooded
objects.text:
Your lineage traces back to a phantasmal giant. Your frame trends larger and denser, with monstrous strength, durability, and sheer presence that distorts how people perceive you. On some cases you might be able to overpower Servants using only physical strength. 

The downside? your mind works slower than other species and you often find yourself unable to reason properly regardless of your actual intelligence.

objects.title: Incubi/Succubi Hybrid
objects.text:
You’re the inconvenient midpoint between human and incubus/succubus, wrapped in a body that automatically weaponizes attraction. 

Your physical stats are pushed well above standard human, comparable to an Oni but more compact, and you can draw strength from desire and intimacy. The cost is an uncomfortable dependence on human ehm- sexual fluids and life force, plus a fairy-like difficulty expressing genuine emotion.

objects.title: Daemon-Fused
objects.text:
Due to some experiments or through some other means, your body and soul are mixed with those of a Demon Gods. Usually their conscience will overpower any human but through some means, yours were able to overpower them. As a result, you gain their abilities from durability, greater physique, an ageless body, and affinity to darker forms of magecraft. 

However the original Daemon didn't disappear and still exist as a voice in your head. And even without their meddling, you'll find your general behaviours to be much more twisted than usual.

objects.title: Dragon Blooded
objects.text:
Your body held the DNA of Dragons. A creature considered to be the pinnacle of Phantasmal Species. Due to this, the magical energy produced by your body is exceptionally high. You'll also gain immortality and a high level of magical resistance that are able to resist even magecrafts from the Age of Gods. Your physical strength is also extremely powerful, comparable to those of giants. 

While you can't turn into a Dragon form at will, within specific circumstances, you might be able to turn into one with the cost of your identity.

objects.title: Divine Blooded
objects.text:
One of your ancestors were Gods. You got an exceptional affinity to Magecraft originated from the Age of Gods, exceptionally powerful magecraft that are unable to be achieved using modern means. You're even able to use them in modern world albeit in a weaker form. 

You have a massive amount of magical energy comparable to those of Dragons and a generally strong physique. You also gain a small amount of Divinity that gives you high resistance to magecrafts and physical attacks. Due to your divinity, your attack might also include some properties that ignore the defense of your target.

objects.title: Terminal of The Dark Star
objects.text:
You wasn't the original human, but rather an Angel Artifact recreation of them. These artifacts all have a rare and bizzare activation method and through some bad lucks, your human-self were there when the world satisfy the requirement.

Due to this, you will have less affinity to human and earth-based magecraft but in trade you possess a special ability outside of this world, originating from creatures from more 14 Billions Light Year Away. These abilities can rival and outclass even Heroic and Divine Spirits.

You can choose what ability you have, these abilities would be in the same tier as an A-B Tier Noble Phantasm.

rows.title: Species
rows.titleText: Under all the drama and world-ending nonsense, you still need a body. This is where you pick what kind of creature you are under the skin. It's weird, but your biology decides how hard the world has to work to kill you…

objects.title: Jack of All Trades
objects.text: You have the knowledge to the general form of Modern Magecraft and are able to perform it effortlessly. That being said, unlike others on the A-team you aren't exceptional in any of them.

objects.title: Zemlupus Anti-beast magecraft
objects.text: Kadoc's family magecraft specialization that are used to fight and deter animals. Although mostly obsolete in the modern world, its useful to track and fight demonic beasts.

objects.title: Clock Tower Teaching
objects.text: You're familiar with the teaching of The Clock Tower and as result, you have the fundamentals of Magecraft and are able to use basic and advanced forms of Magecraft that are available in Clock Tower general Curriculum.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Prolongation
objects.text: A Jewel-Ranked variant of Mystic Eye of Precognition, that allows Ophelia to perceive the "possibilities" associated with a targeted existence and to forcibly cull them, restricting the advancement of events pertaining to the target to a single course.

objects.title: Yu Mei Ren
objects.text: Akuta Hinako true identity is Yu Mei Ren, an incarnated Elemental closely related to True Ancestor. She has lived since the Age of Gods before she settled in China for a period of time around 200 BC, becoming the concubine of Xiang Yu.

objects.title: Jinsokutsū
objects.text: The power of unimpeded movement, allows Peperoncino to run and move at superhuman speed. His speed is potent enough and allow him to contend with Servants such as Ashwatthaman's and Musashi

objects.title: Tashintsū
objects.text: The power to read minds, in Peperoncino's case he can reads the intentions of human and non-human beings through the colors of their auras.

objects.title: Rōjintsū
objects.text: The ability to be aware of their own destiny and lifespan, not disimilar to enlightenment in buddhism. Rōjintsū is a power that ends the user's own reincarnation, and through the use of Tashintsū, Peperoncino was able to apply this effect on others as well

objects.title: Anima Animusphere
objects.text: Kirschtaria has a high affinity to Age of Gods Magecraft. As a result he was able to use Magecraft in a completely different realm than other Magus. His magecraft is so powerful that it can contend with the likes of Zeus.

objects.title: Bizarre Reality Marble: Red Hood
objects.text: An Unknown Reality Marble possessed by Beryl. It was presumed to use the famous fable Red Riding Hood as a basis for it.

objects.title: Imitation
objects.text: Beryl can shapeshift into creatures such as Fairies or Demonic Beasts by eating those creature.

objects.title: Witchcraft
objects.text: Beryl uses Witchcraft as his specialty, using a style of Witchcraft tailored towards using and manipulating "life" as its main ingredient, that is specifically tailored for assassination, torture and murder.

objects.title: Terminal of The Dark Star
objects.text: Daybit is the Terminal of the Dark Star, having formed a connection through the Wooden Halo Angelic Artifact. Through his connection, he can summon entities which are also classified as Angelic Artifacts. The creatures summoned through this ability wasn't Servants but rather aliens from a place more than 14 billion light years away. Daybit is a mirror image; the higher combat power the enemy has, the more of these shadows he can call forth.

objects.title: Day Bits
objects.text: Due to the incident with the Angelic Artifact, Daybit has memory defect that causes him to only record five minutes of memory of every 24 hours; each day to him would only be 5 minutes worth of events. He doesn't decide what to remember in real-time: at the end each day, he can choose 5 minutes and then has to cut off the remaining 23 hours and 55 minutes.

objects.title: Demi-Servant
objects.text:
Mash existence is as conceptual humans who have taken the Saint Graphs of Heroic Spirits into their bodies, functioning as Servants. Unlike Pseudo-Servants, the Heroic Spirit has minimal control over the shared form; instead, the human merged with the Heroic Spirit uses the Heroic Spirit's abilities as if they were their own. 

You're free to choose 1 Point or 2 Point Servants as Demi-Servant and Discount to higher Point Servants

objects.title: Malachite, Ruby, Lolite
objects.text: Yvette's family is able to cut gems and turn them into artificial Mystic Eyes, extremely close to natural ones. She has a number of Mystic Eyes of her own, fashioned from precious stones, which she can swap out. Malachite function as Mystic Eye of Emotion Sight, Ruby function as Mystic Eye of Combustion, and Lolite function as Mystic Eye of Compulsion.

objects.title: Rail Zeppelin
objects.text:
Yvette family are specialized in the creation of artificial Mystic Eyes and a  regular attendees of the Mystic Eyes auction of the Rail Zeppelin. Due to this they're able to create various kinds of Mystic Eyes on their own.

Discount on Blue/Red, Gold, and Jewel Mystic Eyes

objects.title: Prodigy
objects.text:
Flat's ability as a Magus is extremely high with "boundless potential and talent", surpassing all of his peers, but his overall ineptitude greatly squanders his potential. He was born with Magic Circuits that are of orders of magnitudes greater than his previous generations, and like capillaries, they filled every inch of Flat's body with Od. He is known as a person who could use all sorts of Magecraft regardless of Mana, Od, or knowledge. 

You're able to use any Magecraft, even if you don't pick it, but the effectiveness will be weakened, and you're able to cast any Magecraft you picked at a greater level than it should be.

objects.title: Vessel for King Arthur
objects.text: Gray is the vessel for King Arthur that one family once tried to create. They tried to faithfully recreate the body of the ancient king and it exhibits abilities impossible for regular humans. But from Gray's point of view, these were all changes that suddenly started happening to her, and even know she still can't accept her new face as her own. After the 5th Fuyuki Holy Grail War, Gray inherit her Magic Core, allowing her to use Mana Burst.

objects.title: Add
objects.text: Gray possesses a unique Mystic Code referred to as "Add". Add has its own ego and is capable of speech and independent thought. Add typically stays in a birdcage and Gray usually keeps it hidden beneath her cape, behind her right sleeve. The true function of the Mystic Code is to seal Rhongomyniad away and prevent it from losing its Mystery.

objects.title: Rhongomyniad
objects.text: When Add's second stage restraint is rescinded, Add reveals the Noble Phantasm kept concealed within him: Rhongomyniad: The Lance that Shines to the Ends of the World, the Holy Lance of King Arthur, that has been passed down through the generations by preserving its Mystery via Add. By suspending Add's pseudo-personality, Add temporarily releases the seal on Rhongomyniad, allowing Gray to wield the spear.

objects.title: Volumen Hydragyrum
objects.text: One of the Supreme Mystic Codes of the El-Melloi faction, one of the twelve families of the Clock Tower. Flexible, transformable. If it becomes an unmatched weapon, it can even transform into a firm armor that strengthens the abilities of the whole body. If needed it can also become a mercury maid. Under Reines, this Mystic Code normally took the form of a Maid Automata called Trimmau, which specializes not only in acting as a bodyguard, but also in using her body to clean and invade places.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Detection
objects.text: Reines possesses a particular kind of Mystic Eyes that allow her to see normally invisible Magical Energy, like the Mana in her surroundings and the spirits of the dead. When her eyes come into contact with Magical Energy, they start turning red as a side effect, though she can also activate them manually. This has been compared to an allergic reaction, and she has eyedrops to calm the burning sensation and turn them blue again. If the Magical Energy is intense enough, her eyes can even catch on fire.

objects.title: The Twelfth Lord
objects.text:
Waver is the youngest Lord the Clock Tower had ever seen. Amongst the twelve nobles who administer the Clock Tower, he's the lowest-ranked. He attained the fourth-order rank, "Fes", due to how good of a teacher he was, though if judged solely on his own abilities he would be the lower rank of "Count". He was previously in charge of the Department of Mineralogy until he changed to the 12th Department of Modern Magecraft Theory.

Discount to all Magecraft

objects.title: Spiritual Evocation
objects.text: The Forvedge family Magecraft is Spiritual Evocation, every members of the family are able to summons low-class spirits, insects, and animals.

objects.title: Bronze-Link Manipulator
objects.text: Fiore had produced the Mystic Code Bronze-Link Manipulators: Coupled Reinforcement Mystic Codes with her own alterations that boast the power to allow even a third-class Magus to bring down a first-class Magus. The true nature of the Bronze-Link Manipulators is to serve as four giant magic-powered spider-like limbs, as an exoskeletal mecha-armor. It consists of four prosthetic arms equipped to her back. It was forged using a special alloy that easily conducts mana and is possessed by four animal (dog) spirits, so while Fiore can move them according to her will, the arms also move automatically to protect their master.

objects.title: Eulyphis
objects.text: Fiore possesses an ability called "Eulyphis" or Spirit Medium. She uses Spiritual Evocation Magecraft, but she doesn’t communicate or have herself possessed by spirits directly, instead favoring Mystic Codes made of mechanical parts which have several animal spirits inserted into them. She was able to create or enhance mystic codes by using this ability

objects.title: Average One
objects.text: Rin was born capable of manipulating all five great Elements, an extremely rare trait for a Magus. Her potential is such that she will eventually be considered as one of the top one hundred ranking magi throughout the entire history of the Mage's Association.

objects.title: Conversion of Power
objects.text: As the successor to the Tohsaka family, Rin excels in Conversion of power, which includes storage of Magical Energy in objects, typically jewels for Jewel Magecraft, as they are easy targets to transfer Magical Energy into due to being 'places' that easily store people's thoughts.

objects.title: Edelfelt's Kaleidoscope
objects.text: Luvia has one hundred Magic Circuits, though how many are natural or part of her Crest is unknown. She also showed the ability to gather enough magical energy to "obliterate even the likes of lower to medium ranked Phantasmal Species". Using Jewelcraft, Luvia can unleash a wide variety of magecraft in different variations through the use of a plethora of gems

objects.title: Forklift Lady
objects.text: Luvia is trained in the England-original Lancashire-style of martial combat (which is quite similar to pro-wrestling) and received the nicknames of "Hunting Dog of the Ring" and the "Forklift Lady" for it.

objects.title: Fragarach
objects.text: Fragarach is a Noble Phantasm and Mystic Code with the ultimate form of counterattack. It is the "Sword of Retrograde" and an indefeasible weapon of the gods, divinely protected by some malicious will, that works by using a conceptual curse to warp destiny and a divine trick that uses time as its blade. It is originally belonged to Manannán, the God of the Sea and Otherworld, who gifted it to the Sun and War God Lugh. It is one of the few remaining Noble Phantasms left in the world, and it is one of the few remaining relics not yet attached to a Heroic Spirit.

rows.title: Character Specials

objects.title: Lawful Good
objects.text: You outright reject the Alien God’s goals and still care about humanity as something worth saving. The only thing keeping you is your loyalty to your Crypter friends and that you know you don't stand any chance. You’ll play your role, defend your Lostbelt as, maybe even quietly help Chaldea when nobody’s looking. You’re the type who follows orders… until someone tries to make you sacrifice what you can’t bear to lose.

objects.title: Neutral Good
objects.text: You see the Alien God as an enemy, but your loyalty isn’t pinned to any one side. You’ll quietly sabotage bad plans, support Chaldea or other rebels when it matters, and step in to help if someone seems capable of turning the tide… You’ll humor the Alien God and protect your Lostbelt, but if Chaldea or humanity offers another path, you’ll happily switch sides.

objects.title: Chaotic Good
objects.text: You’re aiming for a miracle with both hands tied behind your back. You genuinely want a better future for humanity… you’ve just decided the current world is too small and stupid to host it. You’ll borrow the Alien God’s power, use your Lostbelt as a proving ground, and if needed, trample both it and Proper Human History. You’re on “humanity’s side,” just not the fragile, flawed version.

objects.title: Lawful Neutral
objects.text: You couldn't care less with the Alien God motive. You’re here to do the job and swing the blade, nothing more, nothing less. Good or Evil is Irrelevant. You might show mercy or cruelty depending on what the task demands, but it’s never personal. It’s just work.

objects.title: True Neutral
objects.text: You’re not a saint and you’re not a monster. You care about your Servant, your Lostbelt, and maybe a tiny handful… but cosmic justice? Too big, too far. You’ll fight and occasionally surprise yourself, but mostly you’re just trying not to die or disappoint everyone again.

objects.title: Chaotic Neutral
objects.text: Crypter, Alien Gods, Chaldea, Humanity... You don’t care about any of that. You just want to be left alone with the ones you’ve decided are yours and the quiet little world you like. You’ll help, betray, kill, or walk away entirely based on mood, memory, and old grudges

objects.title: Lawful Evil
objects.text: You serve a higher order, church, god, Alien God, whatever you believe they are, and then you let that justify everything you do. You speak gently, offer good advice, and orchestrate atrocities with the same calm devotion, because other people’s suffering is both your duty and your private little joy.

objects.title: Neutral Evil
objects.text: You’re loyal only to profit and your own amusement. You’ll sign contracts with Alien God, Chaldea, Grands, Beasts, or Alien Spider as long as the payout is good. You don’t believe in saving humanity or honoring the Alien God’s grand design, you believe in turning this whole war into your personal marketplace of blood and contracts.

objects.title: Chaotic Evil
objects.text: You're an evil madman who put everything in jeopardy by your action. The Alien God gave you a playground, Chaldea brings new toys to break, and your Lostbelt is the hunting ground you never deserved to have. You’ll nod along with the Alien God’s plan when it keeps the game going and ignore it when it gets in the way of your fun.

rows.title: Alignment
rows.titleText: The Alien God has plans, Chaldea has complaints, and you’re stuck in the middle with a crown. This page decides where your heart actually points, lawful, chaotic, heroic, selfish, or just completely done with everyone.

objects.title: Department of General Fundamentals
objects.text: Core theory, Reinforcement, fields, elemental basics, the “101 courses” of the Clock Tower.

objects.title: Department of Individual Fundamentals
objects.text: Everything about the body, mind, and internal systems of a magus.

objects.title: Department of Spiritual Evocation
objects.text: Dead, spirits, exorcism, and anything that deals with “the other side.”

objects.title: Department of Mineralogy
objects.text: Stones, gems, metal, and hard materials as vessels of Mystery.

objects.title: Department of Zoology
objects.text: Beasts, mystic creatures, and the boundary between human and monster.

objects.title: Department of Astromancy
objects.text: Stars, Fate, celestial mathematics, and time-adjacent Mysteries.

objects.title: Department of Creation
objects.text: Mystic Codes, constructs, formulae, and the high art of building systems.

objects.title: Department of Curses
objects.text: Hexes, malign mysteries, and everything polite magi claim they don’t study.

objects.title: Department of Lore
objects.text: Forbidden theories, exoanthropic artifacts, and concept-level meddling.

objects.title: Department of Archeology
objects.text: Relic and ruin magecraft: excavating, decoding, and weaponizing buried mysteries.

objects.title: Department of Botany
objects.text: Plant-based magecraft: living catalysts, curse-eating gardens, and medicinal groves.

objects.title: Department of Modern Magecraft Theory
objects.text: New-age systems, techno-magecraft, and “unorthodox” approaches.

objects.title: Department of Policies
objects.text: Enforcement, secrecy, and policing the Moonlit World

rows.title: Clock Tower Department

objects.title: Complete Obedience
objects.text: The ability to force a Servant to obey your order, even if they don't want to. Orders that are phrased more exact are more potent while vague orders can be completely ignored by the servant depending on your affinity.

objects.title: Teleportation
objects.text: For Servants that don't have an instant means of Transportation. Command Spell can be used to instantly teleport the Servant to the Master side.

objects.title: Temporary Magical Boost
objects.text: Command Spell can also be used to temporarily boost the status of your Servant, whether it's their Strength, Regeneration, Durability, or Agility they will be increased to an exceptional level (usually 2 rank above) temporarily.

objects.title: Noble Phantasm Release
objects.text: Usually the use of Noble Phantasm will need massive magical energy support from the master and some Master might not be able to use it to full potential. The use of Command Spell allows a Servant to use their Noble Phantasm regardless of the condition of themselves or their Master.

rows.title: Command Spell
rows.titleText:
Proof that you’re a proper Master and not just some weirdo waving tarot cards at Heroic Spirits. These sigils on your hand are compressed miracles: limited-use spell bombs you can detonate to supercharge a Servant, teleport them to your side, or ram an order straight through their free will. 

You only get a handful of charges, and once they’re gone, all you have left is your charm, your circuits, and whatever’s still willing to listen to you

objects.title: 1 Command Spell
objects.text: Maybe you used it already or maybe because of something else, but you're down to a single charge. One miracle, one absolute command, and then you’re just a mage with a fancy scar. Try not to waste it, okay?

objects.title: 3 Command Spell
objects.text: The classic loadout. Three shiny, standard-issue Command Spells stamped on your hand: enough to bail you out of disaster a few times, not enough to spam. This is the baseline every “proper” Master get.

objects.title: 6 Command Spell
objects.text: Thanks to a particularly reckless Chaldea experiment, your body can host twice the normal amount. Six charges, six chances to twist a battle or override a Servant’s will. You can get a bit reckless but not too much.

objects.title: 12 Command Spell
objects.text: Someone pushed the experiment way past “approved limits,” and now your body is practically a Command Spell farm. Twelve charges at once turns you into a walking anomaly. Congratulations!

rows.title: How many Command Spell you have?
rows.titleText: Normally you only get three pretty tattoos and then you’re done. But currently everything is all but normal. Decide how many charges you walk into this story with…

objects.title: Refillable Command Spell
objects.text:
Normally, once you burn through your Command Spells, that’s it. This option flips the table a little: you can install a stolen Chaldea prototype that slowly grows your sigils back… with some very strict limits.

Each mark re-forms after about a week of cooldown, but you can never exceed the maximum number you chose earlier, no infinite stacking, just a very abusable reset button if you live long enough between crises.

objects.title: Rank E
objects.text: Your soul barely qualifies as a Master; even a sleepy Servant can shrug you off. Simple orders are often ignored outright, and forcing an ordinary Servant to commit suicide would take all three Command Spells at once.

objects.title: Rank D
objects.text: Well, you’re technically a Master, but it’s nothing to brag about. Your Servant’s parameters are slightly lowered, and if you phrase a Command Spell too vaguely, they can just pretend they “didn’t quite catch that.”

objects.title: Rank C
objects.text: Solidly average potential. Direct, clear orders land properly and empower your Servant, while vague commands only nudge them a bit. Not impressive, not pathetic, just standard-issue Master quality.

objects.title: Rank B
objects.text: Great Master Potential. Even fuzzy orders tend to stick, resisting them drags your Servant’s parameters down, and their base stats are noticeably higher than normal.

objects.title: Rank A
objects.text: Incomparably stronger than normal. Almost nothing can truly ignore your Command Spells, not even Beast class monstrosities. Any order you give becomes an exceptional boost.

rows.title: Master Rank
rows.titleText: This is your innate talent as a Master, and how seriously the world takes your orders. A high rank means your voice hits like a commandment, your magic bites harder, and even a stubborn Servant has trouble ignoring you. A low rank means… well, you’d better be very polite to your heroic murder machine.

objects.title: Spiritual Enhancement I
objects.text: You expand your spiritual “battery”, enough to sustain more Servants or push a single one well above standard quality. From here on, your lineup stops looking embarrassingly underfed.

objects.title: Spiritual Enhancement II
objects.text: You expand your reserves again, tuning your body to support stranger, heavier Heroic Spirits. Unconventional or high-maintenance Servants become viable summons

objects.title: Spiritual Enhancement III
objects.text: Increase your Spirit Energy to the maximum that your body can handle. Allowing the summons of Servants that are normally unsummonable

objects.title: Spiritual‎‎‎ ‎  Overcharge
objects.text: You deliberately overclock your spirit core past “healthy,” forcing out enough power to field even more Servants than your frame was designed for.

objects.title: To Protect Humanity
objects.text: Your heart is set to protect humanity from the incoming calamity. Your magecraft & servants will be stronger against enemy that are a perceived to be a threat to humanity. Allow the summoning of Grand Servants.

objects.title: Threat to Humanity
objects.text: You already sold your humanity away, they essentially means nothing to you. Your Magecraft & Servants will be stronger against human or proper human history servants. With Divine Core, allow the summoning of Beast Class servants.

objects.title: Divine Core
objects.text: A Core with great energy that allow the manifestation of powerful beings that are normally unsummonable. Such as Divine Spirits and Beast-class Servant. Also grant a large amount of Magical energy to ordinary Servants. Redirecting the burden from the master to the core.

rows.title: Master Potency
Servant
rows.titleText: Okay, now that you’ve set up your cute little branch, it’s time to decide who're accompanying you to it. This page is where you pick the Heroic Spirits, Divine Spirits, and assorted nightmares willing to answer your call and fight for you. At least one Servant is required to keep you alive, but if your spirit energy can handle it, you’re free to build an entire dysfunctional family of them.

rows.title: Saber
Archer
Lancer
Rider
Caster
Assassin
Berserker
Extra
Divine
Grand Servants
Beast
Custom

objects.title: Faker
objects.text: You summoned the wrong Servant. Or rather, the servant you summoned was another heroic spirit pretending to be that servant. They're often less famous than the actual heroic spirit you're trying to summon.

objects.title: Lily
objects.text: The Heroic Spirit you summoned was younger than their prime age. They often just started their journey and not as experienced or strong compared to their prime self. On the bright side, they're cuter.

objects.title: Alter-Ego
objects.text: Instead of their full, balanced self, you summoned a distilled personality shard: an embodiment of one aspect, emotion, or role the original Servant carries. This shard is strong enough to stand as its own being and manifests as an Alter-Ego.

objects.title: Gender Bender
objects.text: The Heroic Spirit you summoned had different gender than their legend suggest. Maybe it's an alternative universe version or something wrong with the summoning, regardless their ability stays the same.

objects.title: Class Change
objects.text: Through some modification in the ritual, you can summon a servant in different Class than they normally are. They can have entirely new skills and even Noble Phantasm. Only cover the class change.

objects.title: Alter
objects.text: The Heroic Spirit you summoned has an altered aspect compared to their normal selves. Alters are the same Heroic Spirit regardless of the differences between them. This only cover the inversion, not other thing that may come with it.

objects.title: Lostbelt Version
objects.text: Instead of their proper human history version, the servant you summoned was their Lostbelt version. They have a completely different history, skill, Noble Phantasm and can even be different person who just inherit the same name.

objects.title: Divinity
objects.text: The Servant you summoned is an avatar of a Mythological god. While isn't as strong as pure Divine Spirit, They possess some of the divinity and authority. Their personality can be their original, the Divine Spirit personality, or some combination between the two

objects.title: Divine High Servant
objects.text:
Instead of only one Divine Spirit, your Servant have multiple Divine Spirit shoved into him/her (Choose 2 Divine Spirits that they possess). 

High-Servants have a "main essence" that can be switched to allow for the output of different skills and Noble Phantasms.

objects.title: Existence Outside the Domain
objects.text:
In addition to their original self, your Servant is also a vessel for The Outer God. Entities that are removed of the Common Sense of Man, the laws of physics, the principles of Magecraft, and from human mentality. Due to this their class will shift into "Foreigner"

They will be able to tap to the massive power of these "Gods", but not without a cost.

objects.title: Grand Servant
objects.text:
Through extraordinary circumstances, your Servant has been elevated to the position of Grand in their class. 

Their Saint Graph towers several ranks above ordinary Servants, their parameters are brutally high, and they possess a unique Authority that defines their role as Grand. 

You may decide what that Authority is.

objects.title: Beast of Calamity
objects.text:
Due to some alteration, events in your Lostbelt, or some other means, your Servant become one of the Evil of Humanity. A Beast of Calamity that represents evils born from "the karma produced by humanity's progress."

As a Beast they possess a larger Saint Graph, beyond the scope of Servant Saint Graphs. They also possess a distinct Nega-Skill that gave them an authority of a certain aspect that made them a Beast (you can define what and how).

objects.title: Archetype
objects.text:
Wait, What!? No, no, no- You were supposed to summon a Servant, not "The Final Boss of the Franchise."

Somehow you didn’t just grab a Heroic Spirit, you yanked in a full-blown Archetype. Ultimate lifeform that sits at the top of a world and looks at human history like background decoration. You weren’t supposed to be able to touch this thing, let alone sign a contract with it. This isn't just a stronger version of the servant you summoned. Their Saint Graph is completely rebuilt to be “the strongest lifeform of their world”.

rows.title: Servant Modifier
rows.titleText: The Summoning had gone wrong, or right, depending on your perspective. The Servant you summoned is not their normal form but instead has undergoes some modification. Select for each Servants that you want to modify.

objects.title: Hostile
objects.text: Your Servant genuinely wants you dead. They despise you, resent the contract, and would happily watch you get deleted with the rest of humanity. Without Command Spells, they’ll ignore you at best and actively sabotage you at worst.

objects.title: Hate
objects.text: Something happened, your fault, theirs, doesn't matter, and now your Servant outright hates you. They’ll still fight alongside you when it aligns with their own goals, but every order is filtered through grudges. Push them too hard, and rebellion is a very real outcome.

objects.title: Indifferent
objects.text: Default setting. Your Servant doesn’t particularly care about you either way. You’re the current Master, nothing more. They’ll follow reasonable orders because that’s the job, but whether they go the extra mile, or quietly do the bare minimum, depends entirely on their own personality.

objects.title: Friendly
objects.text: Your Servant genuinely likes you. You’re a precious friend, someone they want to see live through this mess. They’ll usually follow your orders, argue when they think you’re being self-destructive, and occasionally ignore commands that would detrimental to you or betray their own core beliefs.

objects.title: Romantic
objects.text: Oh dear, they’re in love. Your Servant treats you as their beloved first and their Master second. They’ll stand at your side through horrors, take hits meant for you, and indulge your requests far beyond what’s reasonable. On the other hand, they can get clingy, possessive, or outright jealous if you form deep bonds with other people, or Servants

objects.title: Devotion
objects.text: Your Servant has gone past simple affection into absolute devotion. You are their purpose. They will throw themselves into any battle, accept any order, and shield you from almost anything. If it comes down to your life or theirs, or even your life or their ideals, they’ll sacrifice themselves and their principles with little hesitation.

objects.title: Plaything
objects.text: Your Servant finds you entertaining. That’s it, that’s the hook. You’re a toy, a pet, or a fascinating little experiment. They’ll follow your commands as long as they’re amused, but they’re perfectly happy to twist your wording, escalate situations, or “interpret creatively” if it makes things more fun for them.

objects.title: Inverted
objects.text: Wait, you’re supposed to be the Master here… right? Somewhere along the way, the roles flipped. Your Servant treats you as their pet, slave, or overly talkative mana battery, and expects their will to take precedence. They might protect you, sure, but following your commands is optional at best and laughable at worst.

rows.title: Servant Relation
rows.titleText: For each Servant you’ve summoned, pick how they actually see you, enemy, coworker, best friend, tragic crush, or favorite chew toy. Their relationship level won’t overwrite their canon personality, but it absolutely decides how badly things go when you give an order they don’t like.

objects.title: Demi-Servant
objects.text: Due to some rituals, you have taken one of the Heroic Spirit Saint Graph inside yourself, making you a Demi-Servant. Due to this you're able to use that servant Abilities and Noble Phantasm as if they're your own. Unlike with Pseudo-Servant, you have full control on yourself while the Heroic Spirit used as a basis have minimal control upon the form, only appearing as a faint presence.

objects.title: Wind
objects.text: One of the Five Great Elements that has Warm and Wet features. In the Mage's Association, they call it noble probably because there are few number of users.

objects.title: Water
objects.text: One of the Five Great Elements that has Cold and Wet features. Both this and Wind are good at liquid manipulation and Kayneth El-Melloi Archibald can make poisonous gas harmless using both of them.

objects.title: Fire
objects.text: One of the Five Great Elements that has Warm and Dry features. It is well suited for destructive Magecrafts, symbolizing life and death. The most common element in Mage Association.

objects.title: Earth
objects.text: One of the Five Great Elements that has Cold and Dry features. Kiritsugu Emiya applies it to "bind" things that he "severed".

objects.title: Ether
objects.text: Also called the Fifth Imaginary Factor according to the teachings of the Mage’s Association. It combines itself with any of the other four Elements in order to actualize the Mysteries of Thaumaturgy.

objects.title: Hollow
objects.text: Imaginary Element that gives its users access to Imaginary Number Space. Lev Lainur used it as a time capsule and Trisha Fellows put her head into it when killed to keep her killer from using her Mystic Eyes.

objects.title: Dual Affinity
objects.text: Affinity to 2 elements at the same time. Very uncommon among magus. Choose 2 from this list (Except Jack of All Trades).

objects.title: Jack of All Trades
objects.text: High Affinity with all the five great elements. It's incredibly rare and magus with this kind of affinity is highly valued among the mage association.

objects.title: Unique
objects.text: Non-standard element that doesn't fit into the tradition school of thought. It's very rare and overspecialized and therefore may cripple one potential for normal magecraft, but exceptional at doing one specific thing.

objects.title: Nothingness
objects.text: In Magecraft, it is defined as that "which is not possible, but materializes", contrasting Hollow which is defined as that "which is possible but not in the physical plane". It has a different meaning than the "nothing" of physics and math.

rows.title: Elemental Affinity

objects.title: Reinforcement Magecraft
objects.text: Magecraft with the purpose of pushing a basis to the utmost limit. It is the foundation of all Magecraft that enhance the existence of the target by pouring Magical Energy. With the use of this Magecraft, you can enhance the strength and durability of inanimate objects allowing paper to be used as a sword or sword to slice through metal.

objects.title: Field Treatment Magecraft
objects.text: This is the fundamental healing taught in the Department of Modern Magecraft Theory. It accelerates the body’s natural healing, eases pain, and stabilizes minor injuries, but does not regenerate lost tissue or purge advanced curses or toxins.

objects.title: Enhancement Magecraft
objects.text: Instead of reinforcing inanimate object, It uses the principle of reinforcement to your own body pushing it to the limit that wasn't possible before. Allowing you to survive bullets, jump at massive distances or increase the strength of your punch for a limited time.

objects.title: Magical Crest
objects.text: Allows storage of certain magical spells in a crest which appears as a tattoo on some part of your body. This allows for instantaneous casting which in battle can be a deciding factor.

objects.title: Runes
objects.text: Systems that originated in Scandinavia during the Age of Gods. Composed of only straight lines and possessing mechanics similar to the Magic Crests. Also allows for faster casting however the difference is with runes you trade a little bit of speed for the number of spells you can store.

objects.title: Curse
objects.text: Practices that one would expect from the traditional (and very clichéd) witches and shamans. Things that fall along the lines of potions, medicines, spirit exorcism and curses that use a material medium (such as a straw doll). They have a strong presence within the Japanese supernatural world. Most of these curses act over time, not immediate, but once it happens they'll have a powerful effect.

objects.title: Thought Acceleration
objects.text: Derived from the Atlas Institute's cerebral spellcraft, this doesn’t affect the world—it affects your perception of time. Grants momentary superhuman clarity, allowing you to strategize, analyze weaknesses, or recalculate rituals in combat.

objects.title: Chimeric Binding Ritual
objects.text:
Using ancient thaumaturgy principles, you may combine two organic creatures into a single unstable fusion. It needs some well-done preparation and are impossible to do mid-combat. 

The resulting creature retains some traits of both, but is warped, often in pain, and short-lived.

objects.title: Mental Echo Reading
objects.text: This technique doesn’t read thoughts directly but catches stray surface emotions, impressions, and flashes of memory. It relies on establishing magical proximity or eye contact to synchronize mind states.

objects.title: Baptism Sacraments
objects.text: A simple ritual with an Aria that falls on the Ten-Count category, it is capable of exorcising Daemons and sending Wraiths back to the world of the dead. Possess weak capacities of physical interference, but its power is overwhelming against Spiritual Bodies. It is ineffective against Spirits on the level of Servants, though.

objects.title: Shikigami
objects.text: A traditional Eastern technique used by onmyōji and aligned magi, Shikigami are paper or spirit familiars animated via binding talismans. They serve as scouts, spies, or magical traps. Unlike Western familiars, they are semi-intelligent but fragile.

objects.title: Presence Concealment
objects.text: Shrouds the caster in misdirection. However rather than truly erasing your form, it manipulates perception to make people ignore or overlook you, similar to how one might overlook a common stranger in a crowd or a piece of stone in a wasteland.

objects.title: Warding Bounded Fields
objects.text: Classic defensive Magecraft. Specialize in creating quick-deploy Bounded Fields—wards that keep threats out, muffle sound, or disorient intruders. While not as permanent or detailed as workshop-level fields, speed makes them useful in practice.

objects.title: Memory Haze
objects.text: A fundamental tool for maintaining the Statute of Secrecy, this Magecraft allows a magus to implant false but simple memories into a civilian’s mind. Often used after magical incidents to prevent exposure of the supernatural world.

objects.title: Crest Worm
objects.text: An ancient and grotesque Magecraft from the Matou family, where mystical worms are implanted into a magus's body. These creatures act as living circuit batteries, enhancing mana capacity, regenerating tissue, and even storing spells. But they hunger, and over time, they change you.

objects.title: Thought Partitioning
objects.text: The ability used by the superior Alchemists of Atlas. Paired with Thought Acceleration, the very proof that one is an Atlas Alchemist, it is the ability to partition their thoughts to form multiple independent thought processes. While normal people can only have a single "room" in their brain and focus on one thought, partitioning can divide this one room into several.

objects.title: Elemental Projection
objects.text: This Magecraft draws upon the user's innate elemental affinity to project mana into physical or environmental effects. While the form differs between elements, the underlying technique is the same: externalizing one’s mana to manipulate phenomena aligned with your soul.

objects.title: Jewelcraft
objects.text: The Magecraft involving transferring magical energy into jewels to use as limited use Mystic Codes. This allows for creative spells such as making magical grenade or portable shield or just a Mana storage which you can take anytime you want.

objects.title: Healing Magecraft
objects.text: Magecraft that involves recovering the flesh of injured people and of detoxification. Allow you to recover yourself or your servant mid-battle. A very useful Magecraft for a master since the servant gonna do most of the fighting anyway.

objects.title: Familiarcraft
objects.text: Magecraft that specializes on summoning familiars to do your biddings. These familiars are not sentient and appear only for a limited time.

objects.title: Projection Magecraft
objects.text: Magecraft with purpose to shape magical energy into the material composition and design of an object that is being imagined by the magus. The better the image in the caster's imagination, the more stable and longer lasting the object will be.

objects.title: Clairvoyant Glimpsing
objects.text: A lesser form of true Clairvoyance. While you cannot see the distant future or snipe across time, you gain fleeting flashes—insights into near-future threats, hidden observers, or potential danger.

objects.title: Golemancy
objects.text: The practice of creating golems. Unlike Familiars, these golems are partially sentient and capable of doing action after being given a general order. However, unlike Familiar, you'll need extensive preparation and ritual to create each of these golems.

objects.title: Shapeshifting
objects.text: The Magecraft which allows the user to take the form of another, be it animal, beast, or another human. During this transformation the user gets the physiology of the being, allowing the use of claws, teeth and the sort.

objects.title: Illusion Magecraft
objects.text: The Magecraft that allows the user to create Illusions, a projection of things that weren't actually there. These Illusions are just images so they wouldn't have any physical properties.

objects.title: Mystic Barrier
objects.text: Generates a protective aura around the body like a weak but flexible shield. Not true Reinforcement or Elemental defense—this is a subtle, reactionary barrier.

objects.title: Mystic Shackles
objects.text: A utility Magecraft designed to restrain and immobilize—from limbs to magical energy flow. Ideal for non-lethal takedowns or suppressing spiritual beings.

objects.title: Code Cast
objects.text: An artificial, pre-programmed system of Magecraft originally developed in the Moon Cell. This technique stores short Magecraft scripts into digital artifacts—tablets, phones, lenses—allowing rapid casting via tech interface by passing magical energy through it.

objects.title: Kabbalistic Numerology
objects.text: Jewish-rooted Magecraft that manipulates numerical symbolism and divine geometry to enact change. By calculating sacred patterns and rearranging cosmic “equations,” you can distort fate, probability, or material order—within tight bounds.

objects.title: Necromancy
objects.text: A Magecraft born through the manipulation of corpses. Allows feats like raising simple zombies or giving birth to cobbled monsters. Those most proficient in their craft are said to have a fate of taking the greatest joys in gathering resources from the wakes of revolutions, coup d'etats, or any massive destruction resulting in genocide

objects.title: Astromancy
objects.text: A form of Magecraft that are weak during the modern age but extremely powerful during the Age of Gods. This magecaft hinges on the mystery contained within stars and other astronomical bodies. On extreme cases these allows the user to generate and manipulate these energies in a form that they wished, be it creating weapons or creating barrages of light to strike their opponents.

objects.title: Etherlite
objects.text: A technique handed down in the Eltnam family. It consists of an artificial Nervous system one micron thick that cannot be seen with the naked eye. It is designed to attach to the opponent's skin, integrate with their central nervous system and read their thoughts and memories. Though the thought-reading function seems vile enough, its ability to "merge with and copy memories and experiences" is actually even more dangerous. This inhumane "acquisition of another's life", which even the Atlas Institute shuns

objects.title: Spatial Transportation
objects.text: Magecraft that allows the user to create a gateway that connects to another point in space (Portals). The Portal generated are very limited in it's distance. It is nearly impossible to accomplish Spatial Transportation in the present, though within the lostbelt it might be possible due to the different amount of mystery.

objects.title: Probability Magecraft
objects.text: A powerful form of Magecraft that affects Destiny itself. This Magecraft allows the user to sway destiny to a more favourable outcome. Some would say performing miracles. However, most of the time the user wouldn't have any control over this power. It's pure chaos.

objects.title: Transmutation
objects.text: This Magecraft manipulates the composition of simple materials, allowing you to reconfigure matter into new forms. True transmutation normally is far beyond modern magi, but within the Lostbelt it's a totally different matter.

objects.title: Concept Reassignment
objects.text: An obscure branch of high thaumaturgy that temporarily shifts the conceptual label of objects. A "door" becomes "a wall." A "spear" might be "a rope." It doesn’t physically alter reality—it warps meaning itself. Tricky and costly, but devastating in the right hands.

objects.title: Imaginary Number
objects.text: A special type of magecraft. A forbidden spell that lays the subconscius bare and turns its negative side into a blade. A power highly effective against spiritual beings, but not so potent against those whose body is not made out of Ether. When the Matou clan restraining spells are used along with this, it is possible to imprison and skewer the target into a separate dimension composed entirely of shadows.

objects.title: Mental Dominion Sigil
objects.text: Forbidden Magecraft that embeds a compulsion glyph onto a target’s magical field. In theory it plants a command to a subject without the need of Command Spell. It does not grant full control, but can force one command: "Run", "Sleep", "Speak", etc. Like a regular Command Spell, The more simple and specific an order, the stronger the urge given to the victim. This mostly only effective on weakened or unsuspecting minds.

objects.title: Time Magecraft
objects.text: Magecraft that allows the user to slow down time or even stop it completely.  It allows for "time adjustment" that can only stagnate the time which has passed and accelerate time in the future rather than something more advanced like "time modification". In short, you can't rewind time.

objects.title: Reality Marble
objects.text: Magecraft that allows materialization and projection of one's inner world onto reality. The created worlds are completely cut off from normal reality, projecting their internal landscape and sealing off the regular World. Reality Marbles represent the pinnacle of all Bounded Fields where the boundary line becomes the space itself.

rows.title: Magecraft

objects.title: Blue
objects.text: "Common" Mystic Eyes, Perception and self-boost. You see/react better or read reality in special ways. Stuff you could usually buy at Rail Zeppelin.

objects.title: Red
objects.text: "Common" Mystic Eyes, Basic offensive / manipulative eyes. Good in a fight, but still “standard rare.” Stuff you could usually buy at Rail Zeppelin.

objects.title: Gold
objects.text: High-grade Noble Eyes. Huge tactical or social impact, quite strong in magus term, but still operate inside “normal” laws of magecraft.

objects.title: Jewel
objects.text: Legendary Mystic Eyes. Break normal magecraft rules and can actualize mystery in any era, can rival even Noble Phantasms in influence or lethality.

objects.title: Rainbow
objects.text: Mystic Eyes abnormalities that can stand next to True Magic in brokenness. Extremely rare. It is said to be an exercise of the Authority of the Divine.

rows.title: Mystic Eyes
rows.titleText: A form of supernatural power concentrated in the eyes, granting the power to interfere with the outer world through sight alone. Mystic Eyes are the oldest magecraft known to humans, deriving from neither ritual nor study.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Recall
objects.text: Anything you’ve seen while your eyes were active becomes perfectly rememberable. Faces, sigils, battle layouts, and texts, down to tiny visual details.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Retrocognition
objects.text: You can watch the past of a place as vivid replay scenes, scrubbing through previous events to uncover exactly what happened.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Clairvoyance (Lesser)
objects.text: You can see a few seconds into your own future, turning close combat into a choreographed dance in your favor. Overuse causes nasty headaches and confusion.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Shared Sight
objects.text: You can stream your current vision to any number of willing allies you’ve marked beforehand, turning your eyes into a living feed for coordinated ambushes and long-range command.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Reflex
objects.text: Your body sees its own best escape routes: faint imagined paths appear in your mind showing where to step, duck, or roll, massively boosting your ability to sidestep attacks and slip through tight openings.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Mapping
objects.text: As you move, your mind builds a clean, persistent layout of the area: rooms, corridors, stairways, enemy positions. You get a mental minimap with accurate distances and angles, perfect for navigation and ambush planning.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Quiet Intent
objects.text: You read emotional intent as subtle glows over people, curiosity, malice, boredom, suspicion, making social scenes and negotiations incredibly transparent to you, even when faces stay poker-straight.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Hidden Presence
objects.text: While active, the world registers you as “unremarkable”: people’s gazes slide past you in crowds, patrols are less likely to notice you, and witnesses struggle to remember details about your face or clothing afterward.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of True Measure
objects.text: Distances, speeds, and angles appear as clear readouts in your vision, giving you flawless judgement for sniping, dodging, throwing, and complex geometry.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Stillness
objects.text: Your field of vision becomes a cage where movement simply stops, freezing bullets, charges, and attacks mid-motion for a heartbeat of absolute stasis.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Weak Point
objects.text: When you look at someone, their body and gear are overlaid with floating ratio marks (like 7:3, 8:2) that show where a strike will do the most damage vs effort.

objects.title: Other Blue Mystic Eyes
objects.text: Design your own self-oriented Mystic Eyes that apply buffs, perception, or self-control to you (or your senses), not others.

rows.title: Blue Mystic Eyes

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Binding (Lesser)
objects.text: Short eye-contact stun that freezes a limb or the whole body for a second or two; perfect for interrupting spells or attacks, but strong opponents can muscle through.

objects.title: Mystic Eyes of Charm
